The first element is ultimately from Latin mustum, - the condiment was originally prepared by making the ground seeds into a paste with must. The second element comes also from Latin ardens,. It was first attested in English in the late 13th century, though it was found as a surname a century earlier."}, {"name": "History", "url": "https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Mustard_%28condiment%29#History", "snippet": "Archeological excavations in the Indus Valley have revealed that mustard was cultivated there.
